Articles.Content:
You may ask me to build spaceplanes for you here. I'll post the planes I made here, so others might be able to access it. I will try to finish a plane per week, as the title suggests. Feel free to request anything you need in the replies.

* * *

Currently, I am not working on a project, so If you request something, I can get to that.

* * *

**Week 1:**

*Requested by:*

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/39703-Veeltch

[Veeltch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/39703-Veeltch)
https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/39703-Veeltch

*Requiements:*

-SSTO

-Can carry the crew of 4 kerbals to Laythe

-Use turbojets. No RAPIERS.

-Sleek&Stylish

*Extras:*

-Lighting

-Docking-capable (+RCS)

-Proper maneuverability

*Description:*

Because firstly, only turbojet-nerva combination was allowed, I had quite a few attempts to build a such craft. After the requiements were optimalized, the 8th setup did make it to Laythe, but quite hardly. So if you don't manage to have a perfectly efficient orbiting, a perfect launch window, perfect aerobraking, you might not get to the destination, or even to the planet. Feel free to use the docking ability to refuel the craft, or remove it to improve the performance. Altough I consider it finished, I'll be still adjusting it, and it might get updated. WARNING! The vehicle is NOT compatible with the current version, due to the "engine stowed" bug. I tried the fix, but id doesn't seem to work. So if this hasn't been fixed, remove the cargo bay from the back. Beware that the ladder is nonnected to that, so that might get removed too. I am making a video of a flight, including further details.

*Action groups:*

1.: Jet mode (toggle jet engines and the intakes. To avoid closing the intakes before flight, activate the turbojets through the staging)

2.:Main rockets (the conventional ones)

3.:Nuclear engine

4.:Docking mode (docking port and assistance lights)

5.:Solar panels

6.:Ladder (at the very back)

* * *

**Week 2:**

*Requested by:*

[nothingSpecial](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/121894-nothingSpecial)

*Requiements:*

-Space shuttle

-Return-oriented

-Mk.3

-Very very small and stout

-STS-like alignment

-Orbital rendzevous

-Docking

-Cargo bay can be easily replaced with fuel tanks

-Template:

![pIlPv67.png](http://i.imgur.com/pIlPv67.png)

*Extras:*

-Lighting

-Good maneuverability

-Expensive vernors only on the shuttle; cheap 1-way RCS on the fuel tank (which cannot be recovered)

-Removing the boosters won't break the balance (if you need less performance, for example for a light cargo, or no cargo)

-Great stability, comparing to the alingnment

-Airbrakes

*Description:*

Because I wanted to have minimal size, but witouth an open cargo bay at the back, I had to add a fuel tank between the engine and the cargo bay. The normal fuel tanks were too large, so instead I used an RCS-tank, wich is shorter. As a result, orbital maneuvering is done with clusters of Puff engines. Because the Rhino engine at the back is unexpectedly heavy, in order to have a proper CoM-CoL alignment, my wings had to be placed further back. Because of the heavily angled wings, the stability is so high that the plane couldn't turn. I managed to counter this with BRUTE FORCE, by adding large control surfaces. This was a tricky part, and I tried EVERY possible alignment of the control surfaces. The best was BIG-S elevons at the ends, medium elevons at the middle, with both pitch and roll enabled, and nothing at the joint. Altough this provides great controll power, at low speeds the shuttle still can't fly. The solution is a very very steep descend path. This works until landing, where the large speed won't let us to land safely. To counter this, an array of airbrakes is clipped into the wings. Use them to slow down after you pull up the nose from the descend. RCS might be necessary right after leaving the pad, and when the large tank is low on fuel.

*Action groups:*

1.:Main engine

2.:Docking mode

3.:Cargo bay

4.:Relase cargo

5.:Solar panels

6.:Ladder

Images:

![jX67EQZ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/jX67EQZ.jpg)

Can carry about 6 tons of cargo (That's what you can put in there). Depending on your gravity turn, you can have 600 DV left after reaching LKO.

![2g4xdam.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/2g4xdam.jpg)

This thread is really a gem!

If it's not difficult, can you please make a small (really small!) return-oriented (not an SSTO, I'm going to launch it on shuttle-alike stack) Mk3 plane? 4-man (only crew part is Mk3 cockpit), capable of reentry and landing on it's own, and not very difficult doing this, and with two sets of engines: balanced for CoM orbital ones and a launch engine that is slightly rotated.

Something like this: [https://i.gyazo.com/3e7f8e15199ef74a6bc5d4a7da5ee070.png](https://i.gyazo.com/3e7f8e15199ef74a6bc5d4a7da5ee070.png)

Docking would be nice, smallest cargo bay would be nice, if I can replace cargo with fuel to fly-by Mun and safely return to Kerbin - it would be nice, but neither of these is necessary.

Would you like somethink like that? or no. Also, would you like to have the rocket with it? Or just the pure shuttle.
